Reviews.Title: “Value for money!”
Reviews.Author: Sigvard65
Reviews.Content: The building is impressive, the stairs and entry are beautiful. Sadly enough, the furniture in the room is of the cheapest, ugliest kind. The beds are comfy, though, and everything is very clean and fresh. The breakfast is excellent and gets refilled up until 10 a.m., when it ends Drawback is the WiFi-connection: we received a card for 6 hours use, which meant you had to log on and off every time you wanted to use it. Not practical at all. Also, it is just for one device at a time. AND the access card was only offered after asking, not automatically. But in general the staff was very friendly and helpful. The speak very good English too.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, the best ever”
Reviews.Author: HalaMasreya1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in amazing location (family run), 2 mins walk from the biggest shooping street in Berlin, the staff are so friendly and always smiling, very knowledgable about whatever you need,rooms so beautiful, very clean, comfortable to stay in,they have an open buffet breakfast which was simply FANTASTIC, with fresh baked bread,cakes...., very clean bathroom and shower, nice view, you get more value for your money than expected, a true gem, my friend advised me to stay there, and I can see why she goes there 3 times a year, I know I will! Oh, and I got free internet access my entire stay, which was SUPER COOL!

Reviews.Title: “Made our trip easier”
Reviews.Author: JulieP55
Reviews.Content: Centrally located hotel with extremely helpful reception staff . They recommended restaurants , booked taxis , tour buses - very friendly. Breakfasts excellent !

Reviews.Title: “Berliners”
Reviews.Author: Ella_Rabbit
Reviews.Content: Real value for money hotel with the most helpful staff on hand. The rooms are spread over two floors with the 2,3 and 4 bed rooms being the best value for money and giving plenty of space . Our room had a large wardrobe, comfy beds and a sitting area. The bathroom was spacious and very clean. The hotel was situated in a quiet area near to the boutiques and underground stations. Reception were on hand to give advice on travel and eateries in the area. In terms of what do do in Berlin , the top recommendations would be the Berlin Wall, Holocaust Memoral, Berliner Dom, Reichstag, Tv Tower - a good starting point would be a bus tour to help get your bearings. If time permits a visit to Potsdam , half hour away , is well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: ysndyr
Reviews.Content: we have made a reservation from the internet for ITB Berlin fair.When i see the photos i was not sure about do i like the hotel or not but when we arrive the hotel we understood with my friends that was right choise.building is very old and nice like all berlin but very wide and comfortable rooms and very good location.and especially thanks for all receptions all of them was great peoples very smiling helpfull and friendly.definitelly i can recomended this place.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JennyJK
Reviews.Content: Good location, very nice and helpful staff, clean rooms and a very good breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just before Easter and highly recommend it. The rooms are large and spacious although the showers are a little on the small side. Staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is well placed for the Zoo which is within easy walking distance and also the upmarket shops on Kurstendamn (not sure of spelling here!). I would definitely come back to Berlin and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Seifert. Oh and they speak excellent English!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ikouts
Reviews.Content: We are a five-member family and we stayed at Hotel Seifert/Berlin for 5 nights. The hotel is in a very good location. We are very pleased with the personel, it is very friendly and helpful. Our room was big, tall, clean, quite and comfortable. The breakfast was very good, and the prices very nice. Our overall experience is Excellent! Ioannis Koutsouridis Thessaloniki, Greece

Reviews.Title: “Great and friendly service, perfect location,excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: SophieAthens
Reviews.Content: I was very satisfied from the Seifert Hotel, personnel was great, informative, very friendly and their English excellent! Breakfast was also very good, way above average for a 3 star hotel! it is situated in a very convenient and nice area, the metro is just 2 blocks away. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Hot water available at all hours and heating. I must admit, when I first checked in to the building I was a little shocked because of the way the hotel is set up i.e. the reception is on the first floor from the entrance, I had found out that reception is available until 10pm, and on my way to my room which was on the second floor until we got to the room going through some locked doors, and the long hall, well I got a little spooked out. However, that was only because we had arrived late, around 10 30 pm and the reception lady was kind enough to wait for us. The nights/days after that everything seemed and was very safe. Also, the Indian restaurant “Spice India” to the next building was more thank excellent! overall, i would go back to the Seifert Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Seifert Hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: Gajda
Reviews.Content: Hotel Seifert is an old, beautiful and well-maintained hotel. Even though the hotel is old the rooms are kept in good shape. The breakfast buffet offers a large range of yoghurt, bread, cold meat and soft drinks. The employees are obliging and they speak both English and German thus they are quite easy to communicate with. It is located near the street Kurfürstendamm which is West Berlin’s largest marked-street. Furthermore it's surrounded by many exiting restaurants and bars. The nearest supermarket is located about 50 meters from Hotel Seifert. Furthermore there is less than 300 meters to the nearest subway. We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Seifert and we can only recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “The Breakfast that Lasts All Day”
Reviews.Author: PurpleClover
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Seifert is well situated - just a couple of minutes walk from the Ku'damm and has several excellent restaurants and friendly bars nearby. Despite its central location, it wasn't noisy at night. Our room was spacious and light with a high ceiling and large windows overlooking a courtyard. The decor and bedding was white, with pale wood effect furniture. The standard of cleanliness was excellent and the bathrooms looked newly fitted and were gleaming and fresh. If I could pick any fault, it would be with the quality of the bedding and towels - although they are all white and very clean, they were a bit on the thin side. And the carpet was a bit dated, although again, it was a flat, office-style carpet so it didn't feel unhygienic or anything! Considering this was a modestly priced hotel, I feel a bit mean even mentioning this. What this hotel really stands out for is the friendliness of the staff and for the breakfast buffet which offers everything (and more!) that you could possibly want for breakfast and serves both hot and cold food. Out of all the German hotels I've visited, this one wins hands down on the breakfast front. And no carpet in the dining room! Pale laminate floor and very clean and fresh. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Uberbit_ch
Reviews.Content: I've been there for 4 nights and it's been absolutely wonderful! I was there as a Group leader for the travel agency I work for and I can assure you that this hotel is absolutely perfect. the structure it's not super, that's true. The wooden floor sometimes makes too much noise, expecially at night, but all the rest is perfect. Rooms are very clean, pretty cool and very quiet; the staff is absolutely lovely and very kind. Don't be afraid to ask pretty much everything cos they are always disponsable and helpful. They care so much of their customers and they will always do the best to make you feel comfy, so that u can have a place to call home for a bunch of days! I have to admit that I had wonderful chats with them, they're even funny! The breakfast is on buffet and it's way yummy. You'll find everything you need to start the day with a burst of energy. Milk, coffee, orange juice, yogurt, cereals, breads, fruit, cakes, cheese, eggs, ham, jam, honey and all that u can think of for an extraordinary breakfast! There's an internet point in front of the reception, and the elevator as well. What else can I say...oh, the position is perfect. It's 3 minutes from the Kurfurstendamm, a huge street full of shopping centers, shops, restaurants, clubs and so on. It's in the west part of the city, but u can reach the east in a bunch of minutes via metro...it works perfectly, it's easy to use and u got a stop 5 minutes walk from the hotel (on the Kudamm). Nothing else to say, the perfect base to enjoy your wonderful holiday in a special city! I'll book there again for sure for my next trip to Berlin!

HotelInfo.Name: Seifert Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Uhlandstrasse 162, 10719 Berlin, Germany
